alert.note: Alert for Inland Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 19 at 1:53PM CST until January 21 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and sleet possible. Very cold wind chills possible. Light icing will result in very slippery conditions on sidewalks, with black ice on roads and bridges/flyaways, including during the morning commute on Friday. Wind chills could range from around 20 above zero to 30 above zero. * WHERE...Inland Willacy County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 12 AM to 12 PM Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, 9 PM Thursday to 9 AM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill or apparent temperatures of 20 above zero will cause frostbite to exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are expected This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Watch means there is the potential for a combination of very cold air and the wind to create dangerously low wind chill values. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation.
